Next, we need to understand what "telecommunications" means. Telecommunications refers to the transmission of information over long distances. 

Finally, we need to understand what "outer space" refers to. Outer space refers to the vast expanse beyond the atmosphere of Earth. 

Putting these together, we can see that the question is asking if the name C-SPAN refers to a form of telecommunications that uses outer space. There is nothing in the definition of C-SPAN that suggests it uses outer space for telecommunications, so the answer is (B) no.

The last letter "N" is short for "Network". From the name itself, we can infer that C-SPAN is a network that uses both cable and satellite technologies.
